rules: Rule1: If restoration activities resume, then restoration activities halt
Rule2: If the project experiences a budget shortfall, then the project continues current operations
Rule3: If the project implements cost cutting measures, then the project does not experience a budget shortfall
Rule4: Either the project implements cost cutting measures, or the project seeks additional funding
Rule5: If the project seeks additional funding, then the project does not experience a budget shortfall
Rule6: If the project plan has approval from the local community, then if the conservation project does not succeed, then the conservation project does not receive funding
Rule7: Either the project exceeds the original scope, or the project does not meet the initial timeline
Rule8: If the project scales back activities, then the project does not exceed the original scope
Rule9: Either the project scales back activities, or the project extends the timeline
Rule10: If the project extends the timeline, then the project does not exceed the original scope
Rule11: If the project updates its methodology, then the project plan is modified
Rule12: If the project receives scientific endorsement, then the project gains international recognition
Rule13: Either the project receives scientific endorsement, or if habitat restoration does not begin execution, then the project updates its methodology
Rule14: If the team identifies endangered species, then if the team conducts the initial survey, then the initial survey for wildlife assessment is completed
Rule15: If the team discovers critical habitat, then if the team conducts the initial survey, then the initial survey for wildlife assessment is completed
Rule16: If the team documents biodiversity increase, then the team identifies endangered species
Rule17: If habitat restoration begins execution, then the conservation project succeeds
Rule18: If the team records ecosystem improvement, then the team discovers critical habitat
Rule19: Either the team publishes a research paper, or either the team documents biodiversity increase, or the team records ecosystem improvement
Rule20: If the project demonstrates environmental impact, then if the project obtains corporate sponsorship, then the conservation project succeeds
Rule21: Either the project demonstrates environmental impact, or the project shows community benefits
Rule22: If the project shows community benefits, then the project proves long-term sustainability
Rule23: If the project achieves conservation goals, then if the project proves long-term sustainability, then if the project obtains corporate sponsorship, then the conservation project succeeds
Rule24: If the project pivots strategy, then the project does not continue current operations
Rule25: If the project implements audit recommendations, then the project undergoes external audit
Rule26: If the team conducts the initial survey, then the team analyzes the survey data
Rule27: If the project hires a data scientist, then if the team analyzes the survey data, then the initial survey for wildlife assessment is completed
Rule28: Either the project hires a data scientist, or the project contracts a research firm
Rule29: If the project contracts a research firm, then if the team analyzes the survey data, then the initial survey for wildlife assessment is completed
Rule30: If the project secures a government grant, then the conservation project succeeds
Rule31: Either the project secures a government grant, or the project obtains corporate sponsorship

Rule32: If it is not the case that either the project faces a legal challenge, or if the project obtains corporate sponsorship, then the conservation project succeeds, then the project enters a mediation process
Rule33: If it is not the case that if the project experiences a budget shortfall, then the project pivots strategy, then the project implements audit recommendations
Rule34: If it is not the case that if the project experiences a budget shortfall, then the project pivots strategy, then the project does not undergo external audit
Rule35: If it is not the case that if the conservation project does not succeed, then the project receives emergency funding, then restoration activities resume
Rule36: If it is not the case that if the conservation project does not succeed, then the project receives emergency funding, then restoration activities do not halt
Rule37: If it is not the case that if the conservation project does not succeed, then the conservation project does not receive funding, then the project meets the initial timeline
Rule38: If habitat restoration does not begin execution, then the team conducts the initial survey
Rule39: If the conservation project does not succeed, then the conservation project receives funding
Rule40: If the conservation project does not succeed, then the project experiences a budget shortfall
facts: Fact1: The project plan has approval from the local community
Fact2: The project achieves conservation goals
Fact3: The project does not face a legal challenge
Fact4: The project does not enter a mediation process
Fact5: The project does not receive emergency funding
Fact6: The project plan is not modified
Fact7: The project does not gain international recognition
Fact8: The team does not publish a research paper
Fact9: The initial survey for wildlife assessment is not completed
